children.value: Behavior is the interaction mechanism in G6. It is used with
. This document introduces the Built-in behaviors in G6. Besides, you can register a type of
introduces how to configure the Behaviors onto the graph.
All the basic graphics Shapes, Items(nodes/edges) can be interacted by events. To achieve it with versatility, there are 14 built-in Behaviors in G6.
Supported by V3.5 or later versions.
Description: Allows users to drag combo;
when dragging combos, which means whether to use a virtual rect moved with the dragging mouse instead of the combo. The effect is shown in the figures below.
when dragging the combo with delegate;

to define the state styles when instantiating a graph. It is empty by default;

Configure the styles for enableDelegate or activeState:
: Specify which key to hold for collapse and expand combo.

By default, the x and y directions are both allowed.
The canvas can be dragged along x direction only.

on the graph to limit the zooming ratio.

The usage of edge-tooltip is similar to tooltip. It will be activated when the user hover the mouse onto an edge.

Description: Allows uers to select nodes by brushing;
: The styles of the marquee. It contains four configurations:
: The callback function when selecting a node.
: The callback function when canceling selections.
: The state of the selected nodes.
: Whether to select the edges when selecting by brushing.
means do not select the edges.
: The trigger button for this operation.
by default, which means the select by brushing operation will be activated by pressing Shift button. Options:
: Select by brushing when Shift is pressed;
: Select by brushing when Ctrl is pressed;
: Select by brushing when Alt is pressed;
: Select by brushing without any pressed buttons. Note that it will conflict with the
Select by brushing when the Shift button is pressed by default. And the edges are selectable as well.
By the configurations above, the operation is activated when the Ctrl button is pressed, and the edges will not be selected during the process.
exists in this mode, their operation will conflict.
It is obvious that the selecting by brushing is activated while dragging the canvas. To avoid this situation, we can assign other values for
. Besides, the following solution also works:
It is a solution to put these two conflicting events into two mdoes. They will be activated on different graph modes. Dragging operation corresponds to
in the default mode. When user switch the state to brush mode by
, the dragging operation will be responsed by
